meanings.definition: To drop (supplies, troops, etc.) by parachute from an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers airdropped food to the people in need.
meanings.sent2: The aid organization airdropped medical supplies to the disaster-stricken area.
meanings.sent3: The superhero airdropped supplies to the stranded hikers, saving the day.
meanings.sent4: Hope was airdropped into the hearts of the war-torn civilians.
meanings.sent5: The idea airdropped into her mind like a gift from above.

meanings.definition: To distribute or deliver (something) in a quick and efficient manner.
meanings.sent1: The company airdropped the new product samples to potential customers.
meanings.sent2: The team airdropped flyers all over the neighborhood to promote the event.
meanings.sent3: The magician airdropped candies into the audience's hands, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Excitement airdropped into the room as the surprise announcement was made.
meanings.sent5: The news airdropped into the town like a whirlwind, spreading rapidly.
